==Events==
*[[1527]] &ndash; Spanish and German troops [[Sack of Rome (1527)|sack Rome]]; some consider this the end of the [[Renaissance]]. 147 [[Swiss Guards]], including their commander, die fighting the forces of [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles V]] in order to allow [[Pope Clement VII]] to escape into [[Castel Sant'Angelo]].
*[[1536]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Cuzco]] commences, in which [[Inca Empire|Incan]] forces attempt to retake the city of [[Cuzco]] from the Spanish.
*  1536   &ndash; King [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] orders English-language Bibles be placed in every church.
*[[1542]] &ndash; [[Francis Xavier]] reaches [[Old Goa]], the capital of [[Portuguese India]] at the time.
*[[1659]] &ndash; [[Restoration (England)|English Restoration]]: A [[Wallingford House party|faction]] of the [[British Army]] removes [[Richard Cromwell]] as [[Lord Protector]] of the Commonwealth and reinstalls the [[Rump Parliament]].
*[[1682]] &ndash; [[Louis XIV of France|Louis XIV]] moves his court to the [[Palace of Versailles]].
*[[1757]] &ndash; [[Battle of Prague (1757)|Battle of Prague]] &ndash; A [[Prussia]]n army fights an Austrian army in [[Prague]] during the [[Seven Years' War]].
*  1757   &ndash; The end of [[Konbaung–Hanthawaddy War]], and the end of Burmese Civil War (1740–1757).
*  1757   &ndash; English poet [[Christopher Smart]] is admitted into [[St Luke's Hospital for Lunatics]] in London, beginning [[Christopher Smart's asylum confinement|his six-year confinement]] to [[Psychiatric hospital|mental asylums]].
*[[1782]] &ndash; Construction begins on the [[Grand Palace]], the royal residence of the [[Monarchy of Thailand|King of Siam]] in [[Bangkok]], at the command of King [[Buddha Yodfa Chulaloke]].
*[[1801]] &ndash; Captain [[Thomas Cochrane, 10th Earl of Dundonald|Thomas Cochrane]] in the 14-gun {{HMS|Speedy|1782|6}} [[Action of 6 May 1801|captures]] the 32-gun [[Spanish frigate El Gamo|Spanish frigate ''El Gamo'']].
*[[1835]] &ndash; [[James Gordon Bennett, Sr.]] publishes the first issue of the ''[[New York Herald]]''.
*[[1840]] &ndash; The [[Penny Black]] [[postage stamp]] becomes valid for use in the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland
*[[1844]] &ndash; The [[Glaciarium]], the world's first mechanically frozen [[ice rink]], opens.
*[[1857]] &ndash; The [[British East India Company]] disbands the 34th Regiment of [[Bengal Regiment|Bengal Native Infantry]] whose [[sepoy]] [[Mangal Pandey]] had earlier revolted against the British and is considered to be the First Martyr in the [[War of Independence of 1857|War of Indian Independence]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Arkansas]] secedes from the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]].
*  1861   &ndash; American Civil War: [[Richmond, Virginia]] is declared the new capital of the [[Confederate States of America]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; American Civil War: The [[Battle of Chancellorsville]] ends with the defeat of the [[Army of the Potomac]] by Confederate troops.
*[[1877]] &ndash; Chief [[Crazy Horse]] of the [[Oglala Sioux]] surrenders to United States troops in [[Nebraska]].
*[[1882]] &ndash; [[Thomas Henry Burke (civil servant)|Thomas Henry Burke]] and [[Lord Frederick Cavendish]] are stabbed and killed during the [[Phoenix Park Murders]] in [[Dublin]].
*  1882   &ndash; The [[United States Congress]] passes the [[Chinese Exclusion Act]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; The [[Eiffel Tower]] is officially opened to the public at the [[Exposition Universelle (1889)|Universal Exposition]] in Paris.
*[[1902]] &ndash; [[Macario Sakay]] establishes the [[Tagalog Republic]] with himself as President.
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[George V]] becomes King of the United Kingdom upon the death of his father, [[Edward VII]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; Twenty-one Lebanese nationalists executed in the [[Martyrs' Square, Beirut]] by Jamal Pasha, the Ottoman wāli.
*[[1933]] &ndash; The [[Deutsche Studentenschaft]] attacked [[Magnus Hirschfeld]]'s [[Institut für Sexualwissenschaft]], later burning many of its books.
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[New Deal]]: Executive Order 7034 creates the [[Works Progress Administration]].
*  1935   &ndash; The first flight of the Curtiss [[P-36 Hawk]]. [[Image:Hindenburg burning.jpg|thumb|''Hindenburg'' disaster]]
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Hindenburg disaster]]: The [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[zeppelin]] ''Hindenburg'' catches fire and is destroyed within a minute while attempting to dock at [[Lakehurst, New Jersey]]. Thirty-six people are killed.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[John Steinbeck]] is awarded the [[Pulitzer Prize for Fiction|Pulitzer Prize]] for his novel ''[[The Grapes of Wrath]]''.
*[[1941]] &ndash; At [[California]]'s [[March Field]], [[Bob Hope]] performs his first [[United Service Organizations|USO]] show.
*  1941   &ndash; The first flight of the [[Republic Aviation|Republic]] [[P-47 Thunderbolt]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: On [[Corregidor]], the last American forces in the [[Philippines]] [[Battle of Corregidor|surrender]] to the Japanese.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[Mildred Gillars|Axis Sally]] delivers her last [[propaganda]] broadcast to [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] troops.
*  1945   &ndash; World War II: The [[Prague Offensive]], the last major battle of the [[Eastern Front (World War II)|Eastern Front]], begins.
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Electronic Delay Storage Automatic Calculator|EDSAC]], the first practical electronic digital [[Von Neumann architecture|stored-program computer]], runs its first operation.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Roger Bannister]] becomes the first person to run the [[Middle distance track event#Mile|mile]] in [[four-minute mile|under four minutes]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; More than 20 million viewers watch the first televised royal wedding when [[Princess Margaret, Countess of Snowdon|Princess Margaret]] marries [[Antony Armstrong-Jones, 1st Earl of Snowdon|Anthony Armstrong-Jones]] at [[Westminster Abbey]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[St. Martín de Porres]] is [[canonized]] by [[Pope John XXIII]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Myra Hindley]] and [[Ian Brady]] are sentenced to [[Life imprisonment (England and Wales)|life imprisonment]] for the [[Moors murders]] in England.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Deniz Gezmiş]], Yusuf Aslan and Hüseyin İnan are executed in [[Ankara]] for attempting to overthrow the Constitutional order.
*[[1976]] &ndash; An [[1976 Friuli earthquake|earthquake]] strikes the [[Friuli]] region of northeastern Italy, causing 989 deaths and the destruction of entire villages.
*[[1981]] &ndash; A jury of architects and sculptors unanimously selects [[Maya Ying Lin]]'s design for the [[Vietnam Veterans Memorial]] from 1,421 other entries.
*[[1983]] &ndash; The [[Hitler Diaries]] are revealed as a hoax after examination by experts.
*[[1984]] &ndash; One hundred three [[Korean Martyrs]] are [[canonized]] by [[Pope John Paul II]] in [[Seoul]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Cedar Point]] opens [[Magnum XL-200]], the first [[roller coaster]] to break the 200&nbsp;ft height barrier, therefore spawning what is known as the "coaster wars".
*[[1994]] &ndash; Queen [[Elizabeth II]] of the United Kingdom and French President [[François Mitterrand]] officiate at the opening of the [[Channel Tunnel]].
*  1994   &ndash; Former Arkansas state worker [[Paula Jones]] files a lawsuit against United States President [[Bill Clinton]], alleging that he had sexually harassed her in [[1991]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; The body of former [[Central Intelligence Agency|CIA]] director [[William Colby]] is found washed up on a riverbank in southern [[Maryland]], eight days after he disappeared.
*[[1997]] &ndash; The [[Bank of England]] is given independence from political control, the most significant change in the bank's 300-year history.
*[[1998]] &ndash; [[Kerry Wood]] strikes out 20 [[Houston Astros]] to tie the major league record held by [[Roger Clemens]]. He threw a one-hitter and did not walk a batter in his 5th career start.
*[[1999]] &ndash; The first elections to the [[devolution|devolved]] [[Scottish Parliament]] and [[Welsh Assembly]] are held.
*[[2001]] &ndash; During a trip to [[Syria]], [[Pope John Paul II]] becomes the first pope to enter a [[mosque]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; The [[The_Last_One_(Friends)|series finale]] of the [[television]] [[sitcom]] [[Friends]] is aired on [[NBC]]. The finale attracts 52.46 million viewers, making it the [[List_of_most-watched_television_broadcasts|fourth most watched television series finale]] in U.S. history.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Ariel Castro kidnappings|Three women missing]] for more than a decade are found alive in the U.S. city of [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]]. [[Ariel Castro]], is taken into custody.
*[[2014]] &ndash; Six people are injured in a [[2014 Guangzhou attack|knife attack]] at a Chinese train station in [[Guangzhou]].
